issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
DBoutputformat is used for writing output of mapreduce jobs to the database and when used with db2 jdbc drivers it fails with following error

com.ibm.db2.jcc.am.SqlSyntaxErrorException: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-104, SQLSTATE=42601, SQLERRMC=;;,COUNT) VALUES (?,?);END-OF-STATEMENT, DRIVER=4.16.53 at com.ibm.db2.jcc.am.fd.a(fd.java:739) at com.ibm.db2.jcc.am.fd.a(fd.java:60) at com.ibm.db2.jcc.am.fd.a(fd.java:127)


In DBOutputFormat class there is constructQuery method that generates "INSERT INTO" statement with semicolon(";") at the end.

Semicolon is ANSI SQL-92 standard character for a statement terminator but this feature is disabled(OFF) as a default settings in IBM DB2.

Although by using -t we can turn it ON for db2. (http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPGG_9.7.0/com.ibm.db2.luw.admin.cmd.doc/doc/r0010410.html?cp=SSEPGG_9.7.0%2F3-6-2-0-2). But there are some products that already built on top of this default setting (OFF) so by turning ON this feature make them error prone.
fields.summary: DBOutputFormat.java appending extra semicolon to query which is incompatible with DB2
fields.environment:
OS: RHEL 5.x, RHEL 6.x, SLES 11.x
Platform: xSeries, pSeries
Browser: Firefox, IE
Security Settings: No Security, Flat file, LDAP, PAM
File System: HDFS, GPFS FPO

comments.body:
I changed the current DBOutputFormat class by checking the product name from connection object to see if it is DB2 then generates "INSERT INTO"  query without semicolon(";"). 

This technique is already used in DBInputFormat class for generating different "SELECT" statements for Oracle and MySQL databases.

Looks like the patch doesn't apply to trunk any more. [~ramtinb], would you rebase your patch according to latest trunk? 
Also,  in your test for testORACLEConstructQuery(), I think we should get rid of "db2" name but using oracle instead. Other looks fine to me.
I did the rebase, plus added @Test annotations and did some refactor in the unit tests.
Thanks [~GergelyNovak]! submit the patch to kick off Jenkins.
